Basic Actions
-------------


A basic action is an action that all players have and does not need to be unlocked by choosing a skill. Here are some of the simplest ones   
 Mush players have additional basic actions (see [Basic *Mush* Actions](/wiki/Actions#Basic_Mush_Actions "Actions")).



### Kick off


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Kick off



* **Target**: Other character
* **Effect**: inflicts 1\-3 points of damage to the target with a base accuracy of 60%
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/9/91/Sneak.png)](/wiki/Sneak "Icon") [Sneak](/wiki/Sneak "Sneak"), [![Icon](/images/9/9b/Solid.png)](/wiki/Solid "Icon") [Solid](/wiki/Solid "Solid"), [![Icon](/images/2/26/Wrestler.png)](/wiki/Wrestler "Icon") [Wrestler](/wiki/Wrestler "Wrestler"), [![Icon](/images/e/ee/Diplomat.png)](/wiki/Diplomat "Icon") [Diplomat](/wiki/Diplomat "Diplomat"), [![Icon](/images/9/93/Crazy_Eye.png)](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Icon") [Crazy Eye](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Crazy Eye"), [![Icon](/images/2/21/Ninja.png)](/wiki/Ninja "Icon") [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja") and [![Icon](/images/9/9a/Hard_Boiled.png)](/wiki/Hard_Boiled "Icon") [Hard Boiled](/wiki/Hard_Boiled "Hard Boiled") skills, [![Icon](/images/d/de/Sleepy.png)](/wiki/Status#General_Statuses "Icon") [Inactive](/wiki/Status#General_Statuses "Status") status, [![Icon](/images/thumb/8/8d/Plastenite_armor.jpg/16px-Plastenite_armor.jpg)](/wiki/Plastenite_Armor "Icon") [Plastenite Armor](/wiki/Plastenite_Armor "Plastenite Armor") item, and [![Icon](/images/4/40/Ian_icon.png)](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Icon") [Ian](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Ian Soulton")'s [![Pacifist.png](/images/4/4a/Pacifist.png)](/wiki/File:Pacifist.png)*Pacifist* trait.
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**


### Hide


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Hide



* **Target**: Droppable item
* **Effect**: Hiding items prevents them from appearing on the room's shelves to anyone but the person that hid them. They still can remain effective (e.g. [MycoAlarm](/wiki/MycoAlarm "MycoAlarm"))
* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Person**] has hidden their \[**object**]*


### Search


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Search



* **Target**: None
* **Effect**: You search the room, discovering one hidden item per attempt.
	+ The action can't fail, if you don't found anything, there isn't anything hidden.
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/5/52/Observant.png)](/wiki/Observant "Icon") [Observant](/wiki/Observant "Observant").
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Person**] has discovered a hidden \[**object**]*
* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information. (log when there's no hidden object)*


### Lie down


 Lie down



* **Target**: Unoccupied Bed/Sofa
* **Effect**: You start laying down and occupying a bed/sofa, to gain extra [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") at cycle change, and extra [![Morale](/images/7/73/Moral.png)](/wiki/Health#Morale_Points "Morale") if a [![Icon](/images/6/65/Shrink.png)](/wiki/Shrink "Icon") [Shrink](/wiki/Shrink "Shrink") is present.
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Person**] is lying down... It's good to just stop and take a break. DestinationÂ : the land of dreams!*


### Get up


 Get up



* **Requires**: Your character laying on a bed or sofa
* **Target**: None
* **Effect**: You stop laying down and occupying a bed/sofa.
	+ Happens automatically when taking **any** other action, or clicking on anywhere in the room other than inventory (clicking on people makes you stand up too)
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Character**] wakes up calmly.*


### Flirt


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Flirt



* **Requires**: Target must be of opposite gender or [![Icon](/images/3/3d/Andie_icon.png)](/wiki/Andie_Graham "Icon") [Andie](/wiki/Andie_Graham "Andie Graham")
	+ [![Icon](/images/7/71/Raluca_icon.png)](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Icon") [Raluca](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Raluca Tomescu") cannot flirt due to her [![Icon](/images/1/17/Paria.png)](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Icon") Antisocial trait, but others can flirt with her and then she can [do the thing](/wiki/Actions#Doing_the_thing "Actions").
	+ Flirt is impossible between [![Icon](/images/5/55/Paola_icon.png)](/wiki/Paola_Rinaldo "Icon") [Paola](/wiki/Paola_Rinaldo "Paola Rinaldo") and [![Icon](/images/1/1f/Gioele_icon.png)](/wiki/Gioele_Rinaldo "Icon") [Gioele](/wiki/Gioele_Rinaldo "Gioele Rinaldo").
* **Target**: Standing character that flirted with yours
* **Effect**: Flirt allows a character whom you flirted with to "do the thing" with you.
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/1/17/Paria.png)](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Icon") Antisocial trait
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: 
	+ \[**Female character**] seems interested in \[**Male character**], the fluttering of their eyelashes is a good indicator of their most intimate thoughts
	+ \[**Male character**] seems interested in \[**Female character**]. The way he looks at her leaves nobody in any doubt of his intentions.


### Do the thing


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Do the thing



* **Requires**:   

	+ None of you have *Done the thing* that day, your partner must not be laying down.
	+ The room has an **empty** bed or [sofa](/wiki/Swedish_Sofa "Swedish Sofa") in it.
	+ There are no bystanders (even asleep) or [cameras](/wiki/Camera "Camera") installed in the room.
* **Target**: Non sleeping character that flirted with yours
* **Effect**: Raises morale by 2 [![Morale](/images/7/73/Moral.png)](/wiki/Health#Morale_Points "Morale") points for both participants.
	+ Can transfer [![Icon](/images/a/a9/Spore.png)](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Icon") [Spores](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Mush") from a mush inventory to their human partner, can transfer [![Icon](/images/2/2c/Disease.png)](/wiki/Illnesses#Diseases "Icon") [Disease](/wiki/Illnesses#Diseases "Illnesses") between humans.
	+ Female characters (including [![Icon](/images/2/21/Frieda_icon.png)](/wiki/Frieda_Bergmann "Icon") [Frieda](/wiki/Frieda_Bergmann "Frieda Bergmann"), but not [![Icon](/images/3/3d/Andie_icon.png)](/wiki/Andie_Graham "Icon") [Andie](/wiki/Andie_Graham "Andie Graham")) have an 8% chance of getting [![Icon](/images/8/8e/Pregnant.png)](/wiki/Status#General_Statuses "Icon") [Pregnant](/wiki/Status#General_Statuses "Status").
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/d/d6/Alert.png)](/wiki/Derek_Hogan "Icon") First Time
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Character**] and \[**Character**] killed the lights and then the strange noises started... A few minutes later, the lights went back on. They seemed in great spirits afterwards.*
* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information.*
* Action flavor: [![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information.


### Guard


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Guard



* **Requires**: Character Level 3 or higher
* **Target**: None
* **Effect**: Keeps any crew members in the room from leaving through any door except the one they entered through.
	+ The stance is broken when any other action is issued.
	+ It counts as "aggressive" action, so guarding a room with [![Icon](/images/4/40/Ian_icon.png)](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Icon") [Ian](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Ian Soulton") or someone with [![Icon](/images/9/93/Crazy_Eye.png)](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Icon") [Crazy Eye](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Crazy Eye") in it costs 2 more [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") (stackable).
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/9/91/Sneak.png)](/wiki/Sneak "Icon") [Sneak](/wiki/Sneak "Sneak"), [![Icon](/images/9/93/Crazy_Eye.png)](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Icon") [Crazy Eye](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Crazy Eye") skills and [![Icon](/images/4/4a/Pacifist.png)](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Icon") Pacifist trait. [![Icon](/images/9/9b/Solid.png)](/wiki/Solid "Icon") [Solid](/wiki/Solid "Solid")/[![Icon](/images/2/26/Wrestler.png)](/wiki/Wrestler "Icon") [Wrestler](/wiki/Wrestler "Wrestler") characters can still throw people out through random doors.
* **[Invisible](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**


  




### Consume


 Consume



* **Requires**: Must not have [![Icon](/images/d/d8/Belly_full.png)](/wiki/Health#Satisfaction "Icon") [Full Stomach](/wiki/Health#Satisfaction "Health") status. If consumable is a [pill](/wiki/Inventory#Drugs "Inventory"), it must be the first one consumed that day.
* **Target**: [Consumable](/wiki/Inventory#Consumables "Inventory") (food, fruits or pills)
* **Effect**: You [consume](/wiki/Actions#Consume "Actions") the item, receiving/losing points and illnesses depending on the consumable. Can make you [![Icon](/images/0/0c/Dirty.png)](/wiki/Dirty "Icon") [Dirty](/wiki/Dirty "Dirty"), unless holding the [![Icon](/images/thumb/a/a0/Apron.jpg/16px-Apron.jpg)](/wiki/Stainproof_Apron "Icon") [Stainproof Apron](/wiki/Stainproof_Apron "Stainproof Apron").
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/b/ba/Frugivore.png)](/wiki/Frugivore "Icon") [Frugivore](/wiki/Frugivore "Frugivore"), [![Icon](/images/e/e9/Caffeine_Junkie.png)](/wiki/Caffeine_Junkie "Icon") [Caffeine Junkie](/wiki/Caffeine_Junkie "Caffeine Junkie") skills and [![Icon](/images/2/24/Mush.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush") status
* [![Icon](/images/b/b7/Discrete.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Secret log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Starving.png](/images/c/c2/Starving.png)](/wiki/File:Starving.png) \[**Consumer**] ate/devoured/munched their Actions/little snack/nice little meal/small meal, burp.*
	+ If mush, it will also create a [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")** log: [![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information.


### Repair


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") / 1 [![Repair Point](/images/6/69/Pa_eng.png)](/wiki/Technician "Repair Point") Repair



* **Target**: Broken equipment
* **Effect**: You attempt to repair the item, the action might fail improving your [Efficiency](/wiki/Efficiency "Efficiency").
	+ See [Repairs](/wiki/Equipment_Maintenance#Repairs "Equipment Maintenance") for more detailed information.
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/3/36/Technician.png)](/wiki/Technician "Icon") [Technician](/wiki/Technician "Technician"), [![Icon](/images/thumb/3/32/Wrench.jpg/16px-Wrench.jpg)](/wiki/Adjustable_Wrench "Icon") [Adjustable Wrench](/wiki/Adjustable_Wrench "Adjustable Wrench") and [![Icon](/images/thumb/b/bd/Alien_can_opener.jpg/16px-Alien_can_opener.jpg)](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Icon") [Alien Bottle Opener](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Alien Bottle Opener"), [![Icon](/images/e/eb/Determined.png)](/wiki/Determined "Icon") [Determined](/wiki/Determined "Determined").
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: repair success log (successful repair)*
* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: repair fail log (unsuccesful repair)*


  




Basic *Mush* Actions
--------------------


A basic mush action is an action that all mush players have and does not need to be unlocked by choosing a skill. These actions are in addition to the "basic actions" already listed above.



### [Extract a spore](/wiki/Extract_a_spore "Extract a spore")


2 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Extract a spore



* **Target**: None
* **Effect**: Creates a [![Icon](/images/a/a9/Spore.png)](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Icon") [Spore](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Mush") and carries it for later use (max 2 carried spores, they don't consume inventory space).
	+ **Always** gives [![Icon](/images/0/0c/Dirty.png)](/wiki/Dirty "Icon") [Dirty](/wiki/Dirty "Dirty") status, even with the [![Icon](/images/thumb/a/a0/Apron.jpg/16px-Apron.jpg)](/wiki/Stainproof_Apron "Icon") [Stainproof Apron](/wiki/Stainproof_Apron "Stainproof Apron") equipped
* **Affected by**: [![Research project](/images/a/a0/Microsc.png)](/wiki/Research "Research project") [**Constipaspore Serum**](/wiki/Research#Constipaspore_Serum "Research"),[![Research project](/images/a/a0/Microsc.png)](/wiki/Research "Research project") [**Antispore Gas**](/wiki/Research#Antispore_Gas "Research"), [![Icon](/images/8/82/Fertile.png)](/wiki/Fertile "Icon") [Fertile](/wiki/Fertile "Fertile"), [![Icon](/images/0/0c/Mycelium_Spirit.png)](/wiki/Mycelium_Spirit "Icon") [Mycelium Spirit](/wiki/Mycelium_Spirit "Mycelium Spirit").
* [![Icon](/images/b/b7/Discrete.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Secret log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Mush**] has removed a spore. It's truly repulsive. And the smell...*


### [Infect](/wiki/Infect "Infect")


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Infect



* **Target**: Non immunized humans, [![Icon](/images/thumb/1/1e/Body_cat.png/16px-Body_cat.png)](/wiki/Schr%C3%B6dinger "Icon") [SchrÃ¶dinger](/wiki/Schr%C3%B6dinger "SchrÃ¶dinger").
* **Effect**: Uses one carried [![Icon](/images/a/a9/Spore.png)](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Icon") [Spore](/wiki/Mush#Attaching_a_spore "Mush") and transfers it to the target.
	+ Mush players can only infect once a day
	+ Humans require 3 spores to convert to [![Icon](/images/2/24/Mush.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush"), SchrÃ¶dinger requires only a single one. When converted, the spores transfered to the new mush dissapear.
* **Affected by**: [![Research project](/images/a/a0/Microsc.png)](/wiki/Research "Research project") [**Mushovore Bacteria**](/wiki/Research#Mushovore_Bacteria "Research"), [![Icon](/images/9/93/Crazy_Eye.png)](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Icon") [Crazy Eye](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Crazy Eye"), [![Icon](/images/4/4a/Pacifist.png)](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Icon") Pacifist and [![Icon](/images/6/65/Infector.png)](/wiki/Infector "Icon") [Infector](/wiki/Infector "Infector").
* [![Icon](/images/0/0e/Camera_icon.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Covert log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Mush**] approached \[**victim**] in a predatory manner... and spiked them discretely!*


### [Sabotage](/wiki/Sabotage "Sabotage")


2 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Sabotage



* **Target**: Sabotable equipment
* **Effect**: You attempt to break equipment, the action might fail improving your [Efficiency](/wiki/Efficiency "Efficiency").
* **Affected by**: [![Icon](/images/b/b3/Saboteur.png)](/wiki/Saboteur "Icon") [Saboteur](/wiki/Saboteur "Saboteur").
	+ [![Icon](/images/b/b7/Doorman.png)](/wiki/Doorman "Icon") [Doorman](/wiki/Doorman "Doorman") allows to sabotage a random door per day for free.
* [![Icon](/images/b/b7/Discrete.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Secret log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information. (successful sabotage)*
* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Personnal.png)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Private log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *[![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **TODO**: Missing information. (failed sabotage)*


### [Mutate](/wiki/Mutate "Mutate")


3 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Mutate



* **Target**: None
* **Effect**: You mutate into [![Berzerk.png](/images/9/94/Berzerk.png)](/wiki/File:Berzerk.png) **Berserker**, healing 4 [![Health Point](/images/2/2a/Lp.png)](/wiki/Health#Health_Points "Health Point"), giving a permanent [![Guardian.png](/images/f/fd/Guardian.png)](/wiki/File:Guardian.png)**Guardian** [status](/wiki/Status "Status"), and improving melee attacks damage on 1Â :hp:.
	+ The berserker will lose any items and active skills it had, won't be able to speak on public channels, and will only be able to Attack, Move and Sabotage.
* [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")**: *\[**Character**] curls up, clearly suffering. The crewmember's cries resonate throughout the room before ungodly bile spews from their mouth and melts their clothing... How horrific! \[**Character**] has completely mutated!*

Adjustable Wrench \- Mushpedia




















Adjustable Wrench
=================



From Mushpedia


 Jump to: [navigation](#mw-navigation), [search](#p-search)



| [Adjustable Wrench](/wiki/File:Wrench.jpg "Adjustable Wrench") **Adjustable Wrench** | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| In\-game Description | Maintenance Stats |
| *The [Icon](/wiki/Technician "Icon") [Technician](/wiki/Technician "Technician")'s best friend. Significantly boosts repair skills.* | N/A |
| Origins | |
| **1** x *Found in  **[Storage](/wiki/Map#Storage "Map")*** | |


This basically functions the same as the [![Icon](/images/thumb/b/bd/Alien_can_opener.jpg/16px-Alien_can_opener.jpg)](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Icon") [Alien Bottle Opener](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Alien Bottle Opener"), improving repair and dismantling success rate by 50% of the base chance.


The effect stacks with that of the *Alien Bottle Opener*, allowing for a 100% efficiency boost with both the *Adjustable Wrench* and *Alien Bottle Opener* equipped.



Affected actions
----------------


1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Repair  
\* [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") Dismantle



* Success chance improved by **50%** of the base chance.
	+ Stacks with [![Icon](/images/thumb/b/bd/Alien_can_opener.jpg/16px-Alien_can_opener.jpg)](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Icon") [Alien Bottle Opener](/wiki/Alien_Bottle_Opener "Alien Bottle Opener") and [![Icon](/images/3/36/Technician.png)](/wiki/Technician "Icon") [Technician](/wiki/Technician "Technician").


Trivia
------


While doing the tutorial, an imaginary Wrench is hidden in  [Front Corridor](/wiki/Map#Corridors "Map") and is used to repair a broken door. The [![Icon](/images/c/c7/Local.gif)](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Icon") **[Public log](/wiki/Privacy_Levels "Privacy Levels")** can thus indicate which players have done the tutorial. The wrench is kept around in simplified mode, but is lost in normal mode.



List of attributes
------------------


* This item grants a **passive benefit** when held.
* When **examined**, this item displays the following text:




An adjustable wrench which can be used for repairing valves, turrets... and everything repairable.

Aggression \- Mushpedia




















Aggression
==========



From Mushpedia


 Jump to: [navigation](#mw-navigation), [search](#p-search)

**Aggression** is the act of performing Aggressive actions on fellow crewmembers. This may be necessary to destroy unmasked [![Icon](/images/9/9f/Mush_icon.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush"), or to eliminate high priority targets if you ARE a Mush. Aggressive actions often make you dirty.
Check here for a list of [Weapons](/wiki/Inventory#Weapons "Inventory") and other combat related equipment.



Contents
--------


* [1 List of Aggressive Actions](#List_of_Aggressive_Actions)
* [2 Strategies](#Strategies)
	+ [2\.1 Mush Strategy](#Mush_Strategy)
	+ [2\.2 Human Strategy](#Human_Strategy)
* [3 Hit Chance](#Hit_Chance)
	+ [3\.1 Instant kills](#Instant_kills)
* [4 Useful skills](#Useful_skills)



List of Aggressive Actions
--------------------------


* Attacking someone with bare hands \-\> Kick Off
* Attacking with the knife \-\> Attack: Knife
* Attacking with a gun \-\> Shoot: \[weapon]
* Infecting someone with a spore \-\> Infect
* Guarding a room or a person \-\> Guard
* [![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **Confirm**: [![Icon](/images/c/c3/Intimidating.png)](/wiki/Intimidating "Icon") [Intimidating](/wiki/Intimidating "Intimidating") \-\> Intimidate
* [![Icon](/images/d/d7/Torturer.png)](/wiki/Torturer "Icon") [Torturer](/wiki/Torturer "Torturer") \-\> Torture
* [![Icon](/images/e/ee/Victimizer.png)](/wiki/Victimizer "Icon") [Victimizer](/wiki/Victimizer "Victimizer") \-\> Anthema
* [![Icon](/images/9/90/Bacterophile.png)](/wiki/Bacteriophiliac "Icon") [Bacteriophiliac](/wiki/Bacteriophiliac "Bacteriophiliac") \-\> [![Icon](/images/0/00/Yellow_sign.png)](/wiki/File:Yellow_sign.png "Icon") **Confirm**: Contaminate
* [![Icon](/images/2/2b/Demoralize.png)](/wiki/Demoralize "Icon") [Demoralize](/wiki/Demoralize "Demoralize") \-\> Buzzkill
* [![Icon](/images/a/a3/Nightmarish.png)](/wiki/Nightmarish "Icon") [Nightmarish](/wiki/Nightmarish "Nightmarish") \-\> Give Nightmares


Strategies
----------


* Try not to fight in the room where [Ian](/wiki/Characters#Ian_Soulton "Characters") is.
* Still it takes 1 [![Free Shot](/images/2/2d/Pa_shoot.png)](/wiki/Shooter "Free Shot") shooter point to shoot with Ian in room.
* If your target is not Ian, [![Icon](/images/2/26/Wrestler.png)](/wiki/Wrestler "Icon") [Wrestler](/wiki/Wrestler "Wrestler") and [![Icon](/images/9/9b/Solid.png)](/wiki/Solid "Icon") [Solid](/wiki/Solid "Solid") can kick out Ian or his target out of the room.
* Attack when your target is low on AP, or is offline.
* Preparations: pick up a weapon, armor, food or the medikit.


### Mush Strategy


* Prioritize targets based on their skills, health, items etc
* If you can't kill everyone, come up with an excuse why you killed someone
* You have plenty of indirect ways of killing people (moral, expeditions, moving the ship, starting a fire, sabotaging oxygen tanks etc)
* In a situation where your target is online but out of MP, duct tape could be useful.
* Use explosives when there are a lot of targets in the same room


### Human Strategy


* If you are targeted, run to Ian or where there are lots of other humans
* Call for help before you attack.
* Try not to target other humans.
* If someone else finishes off your target, leave the room beforehand to not get psychological disorders from witnessing death.


Hit Chance
----------


You should try to calculate how much damage you can do with your [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") before attacking. For example, if you assume your target has 10[![Health Point](/images/2/2a/Lp.png)](/wiki/Health#Health_Points "Health Point"), you should expect to need 5 successful unarmed attacks (average 2 damage each) on them. The base attack chance is 60% but increases with every attack. Approximating that every attack has a 75% chance to hit, you probably need to attack them at least 7 or 8 times, costing 1[![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") each time.



### Instant kills


Sometimes you get lucky with your shots. There is a small chance that a single shot takes your target down from maximum health to 0\.


[![Headshot.png](/images/9/94/Headshot.png)](/wiki/File:Headshot.png)



Useful skills
-------------


* [![Icon](/images/e/ea/Cold_Blooded.png)](/wiki/Cold_Blooded "Icon") [Cold Blooded](/wiki/Cold_Blooded "Cold Blooded"), \+3 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") for every death.
* [![Icon](/images/9/93/Crazy_Eye.png)](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Icon") [Crazy Eye](/wiki/Crazy_Eye "Crazy Eye"), aggressive actions against you cost 2 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") more (essentially a personal [![Icon](/images/4/4a/Pacifist.png)](/wiki/Ian_Soulton "Icon") Pacifist effect).
* [![Icon](/images/5/57/Creative.png)](/wiki/Creative "Icon") [Creative](/wiki/Creative "Creative"), 50% chance to get 1[![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") if you fail an action.
* [![Icon](/images/0/08/Detached_Crewmember.png)](/wiki/Detached_Crewmember "Icon") [Detached Crewmember](/wiki/Detached_Crewmember "Detached Crewmember"), no ill effects for witnessing death.
* [![Icon](/images/e/eb/Determined.png)](/wiki/Determined "Icon") [Determined](/wiki/Determined "Determined"), missed attacks increase success chance more rapidly.
* [![Icon](/images/e/ee/Diplomat.png)](/wiki/Diplomat "Icon") [Diplomat](/wiki/Diplomat "Diplomat"), for **Ceasefire** ability.
* [![Icon](/images/3/3e/Expert.png)](/wiki/Expert "Icon") [Expert](/wiki/Expert "Expert"), action success chances increased by 20%.
* [![Icon](/images/c/c3/Intimidating.png)](/wiki/Intimidating "Icon") [Intimidating](/wiki/Intimidating "Intimidating"), spend 1 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point"), target crewmember loses 2 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point") and 4 [![Movement Point](/images/1/15/Pa_slot2.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Movement_Points "Movement Point").
* [![Icon](/images/e/ed/Shooter.png)](/wiki/Shooter "Icon") [Shooter](/wiki/Shooter "Shooter"), free [![Free Shot](/images/2/2d/Pa_shoot.png)](/wiki/Shooter "Free Shot") points for firing weaponry.
* [![Icon](/images/9/91/Sneak.png)](/wiki/Sneak "Icon") [Sneak](/wiki/Sneak "Sneak"), 25% unarmed penalty, ignores [guards](/wiki/Actions#Guard "Actions").
* [![Icon](/images/9/9b/Solid.png)](/wiki/Solid "Icon") [Solid](/wiki/Solid "Solid"), \+1 damage for unarmed attacks.
* [![Icon](/images/e/ee/Victimizer.png)](/wiki/Victimizer "Icon") [Victimizer](/wiki/Victimizer "Victimizer"), \-20% accuracy for the pariah.
* [![Icon](/images/2/26/Wrestler.png)](/wiki/Wrestler "Icon") [Wrestler](/wiki/Wrestler "Wrestler"), \+2 damage for unarmed attacks.


* [![Icon](/images/9/9a/Hard_Boiled.png)](/wiki/Hard_Boiled "Icon") [Hard Boiled](/wiki/Hard_Boiled "Hard Boiled"), All combat damage reduced by one point.
* [![Icon](/images/2/21/Ninja.png)](/wiki/Ninja "Icon") [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja"), unarmed attacks are anonymous.
* [![Icon](/images/1/1f/Phagocyte.png)](/wiki/Phagocyte "Icon") [Phagocyte](/wiki/Phagocyte "Phagocyte"), eat a spore to gain 4 [![Health Point](/images/2/2a/Lp.png)](/wiki/Health#Health_Points "Health Point") and 4 [![Action Point](/images/e/ec/Pa_slot1.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Action_Points "Action Point").

Aim of the Game \- Mushpedia




















Aim of the Game
===============



From Mushpedia


 Jump to: [navigation](#mw-navigation), [search](#p-search)

Contents
--------


* [1 Goals for Humans](#Goals_for_Humans)
	+ [1\.1 Return to Sol](#Return_to_Sol)
	+ [1\.2 Escape to Eden](#Escape_to_Eden)
* [2 Goals for Mush](#Goals_for_Mush)
	+ [2\.1 Destroy the Daedalus](#Destroy_the_Daedalus)
	+ [2\.2 Infiltration of Sol or Eden](#Infiltration_of_Sol_or_Eden)
		- [2\.2\.1 Surprise, gentlemen!](#Surprise.2C_gentlemen.21)
		- [2\.2\.2 The fungus among us](#The_fungus_among_us)



Goals for Humans
----------------


The mission of the crew is to save humanity from the onslaught of [![Icon](/images/9/9f/Mush_icon.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [The Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush"), which can be achieved in two primary ways.


[![Icon](/images/5/59/Blue_i.png)](/wiki/File:Blue_i.png "Icon") **Note**: Ending the game while there are Mush alive among the crew will result in a Mush victory and [![Glory](/images/5/52/Triumph.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Human_Glory "Glory") loss for humanity.


  




### Return to Sol


The easier option is to **return the Daedalus to [Sol](/wiki/Sol "Sol")** to rejoin the human rebels in their fight against the Mush, hopefully with some helpful research in your pockets. This only requires the ship's main drive, the [PILGRED Reactor](/wiki/PILGRED_Reactor "PILGRED Reactor"), to be repaired, which will enable the [![Icon](/images/9/93/Title_01.png)](/wiki/Titles#Commander "Icon") [Commander](/wiki/Titles#Commander "Titles") to [steer the ship](/wiki/Command_Terminal "Command Terminal") back home. \- After the elimination of all [![Icon](/images/9/9f/Mush_icon.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush") agents, of course.


**[PILGRED](/wiki/PILGRED_Reactor "PILGRED Reactor")** can be found in the Engine Room at the rear of the ship and repairs are mainly performed by [![Icon](/images/7/71/Raluca_icon.png)](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Icon") [Raluca](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Raluca Tomescu"). For best efficiency, [![Icon](/images/3/36/Technician.png)](/wiki/Technician "Icon") [Technician](/wiki/Technician "Technician") characters (or anyone, if *Technicians* aren't available) should reset Raluca's progress regularly. Once *PILGRED* is repaired, the **Return to Sol** action is unlocked in the [Command Terminal](/wiki/Command_Terminal "Command Terminal").


For a generous [![Glory](/images/5/52/Triumph.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Human_Glory "Glory") boost, the cure to Mush infection aka [![Icon](/images/thumb/e/ea/Anti_mush_serum.jpg/16px-Anti_mush_serum.jpg)](/wiki/Retro-Fungal_Serum "Icon") [Retro\-Fungal Serum](/wiki/Retro-Fungal_Serum "Retro-Fungal Serum") must have been researched when the ship sets sail for home. The Serum can be created by conducting [Research](/wiki/Research "Research") in the Laboratory. In addition to [![Icon](/images/thumb/0/08/Mush_sample.jpg/16px-Mush_sample.jpg)](/wiki/Mush_Sample "Icon") [Mush Sample](/wiki/Mush_Sample "Mush Sample") and [![Icon](/images/a/a0/Chun_icon.png)](/wiki/Zhong_Chun "Icon") [Zhong Chun](/wiki/Zhong_Chun "Zhong Chun")'s presence in the lab, researching the Serum requires presence of the [![Icon](/images/thumb/9/91/Mush_floppy_disk.jpg/16px-Mush_floppy_disk.jpg)](/wiki/Mush_Genome_Disk "Icon") [Mush Genome Disk](/wiki/Mush_Genome_Disk "Mush Genome Disk") and a dead Mush as a sample.


Any other completed anti\-Mush research gives bonus [Glory](/wiki/Glory "Glory") upon returning to Sol as well.



### Escape to Eden


The vastly more difficult, but also vastly more [![Glory](/images/5/52/Triumph.png)](/wiki/Player_Resources#Human_Glory "Glory")\-prestiguous option is to **colonize a new utopian world named [Eden](/wiki/Eden "Eden")** as a new base fo humanity. This also requires the repairs of the [PILGRED Reactor](/wiki/PILGRED_Reactor "PILGRED Reactor"), but the crew must also triangulate the position of the wondrous world using three *Starmap Fragments*. 


When doing [Expeditions](/wiki/Exploration "Exploration"), the crew can discover rare alien artifacts; among them the [![Icon](/images/thumb/a/a2/Super_map.jpg/16px-Super_map.jpg)](/wiki/Starmap_Fragment "Icon") [Starmap Fragments](/wiki/Starmap_Fragment "Starmap Fragment"). Researching these enables the construction of the [Calculator](/wiki/Calculator "Calculator") in the Nexus which, if used with 3 of the *Starmap Fragments*, reveals the location of Eden and enables the ship to navigate there, assuming the PILGRED reactor is repaired.


Having the time for all that on top of everything else, however, requires exceptional teamwork and coordination from the crew, as well as being successful at [Mush Hunting](/wiki/Mush_Hunting "Mush Hunting"). Having a [![Icon](/images/e/ee/Diplomat.png)](/wiki/Diplomat "Icon") [Diplomat](/wiki/Diplomat "Diplomat") or [![Icon](/images/0/07/Skilful.png)](/wiki/Polyvalent "Icon") [Polyvalent](/wiki/Polyvalent "Polyvalent") crew member also helps a lot \- against the dangers of meeting alien species, and to increase the chance of recovering *Starmap Fragments* from [Cristalite](/wiki/Zones#Cristalite "Zones") zones.


  



  




Goals for Mush
--------------


Humans are so weak that you can clearly have fun with them in many ways. It's fun to see them kill each other thinking they have you trapped. Whatever you do, you have two major goals. 


  




### Destroy the Daedalus


BOOOM! A beautiful explosion. That's what we love. Bodies floating in space among the debris of the vessel.


[![Icon](/images/9/9f/Mush_icon.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [The Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush") have an instinct for destruction that is insatiable, and there are [several possibilities](/wiki/Mush_Play "Mush Play") to achieve a beautiful result including contamination, attrition, confusion and good ol' murder. 


  




### Infiltration of Sol or Eden


Another way to ensure a Mush triumph is to infiltrate Sol or Eden when by having the Deadalus arrive there with live Mush on board. If you can stay alive and under the radar until the crew finishes PILGRED \- or even do this yourself \- you can sabotage the crew's ultimate directive by infecting either the Rebellion or the new colony, ensuring their downfall rather than the ultimate eradication of the Mush virus.


  




#### Surprise, gentlemen!



A Mush return to Sol is the always looming rush or surprise return, where the Mush themselves \- usually [![Icon](/images/7/71/Raluca_icon.png)](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Icon") [Raluca](/wiki/Raluca_Tomescu "Raluca Tomescu") with some help, or [![Icon](/images/5/55/Paola_icon.png)](/wiki/Paola_Rinaldo "Icon") [Paola](/wiki/Paola_Rinaldo "Paola Rinaldo") with an opportune [trade](/wiki/Trading "Trading") \- finish PILGRED and jump the ship towards their waiting friends before the crew knows what is going on.



This is very powerful and should not be ignored by either team.


#### The fungus among us



The high art of [![Icon](/images/9/9f/Mush_icon.png)](/wiki/Mush "Icon") [Mush](/wiki/Mush "Mush") infiltration, and definitely the required path to infiltrate Eden, is to make the crew believe they have won and are free of Mush. Besides good mimickry, this requires one or more beta Mush so at least two "Alphas" can be killed, the use of [![Icon](/images/4/4c/Anonymush.png)](/wiki/Anonymush "Icon") [Anonymush](/wiki/Anonymush "Anonymush") on the surviviors, and an infected or dead [![Icon](/images/0/0b/Eleesha_icon.png)](/wiki/Eleesha_Williams "Icon") [Eleesha](/wiki/Eleesha_Williams "Eleesha Williams").



Of course, the ship being in such a dire situation that the humans are forced to just gamble and *hope* they got every Mush can help as well.
